title: North Korea at a glance
content: · Democratic People's Republic of Korea, known locally as Choson · Population is 22m · Capital is Pyongyang · Currency: 1 won = 100 chon (= 28 pence) · Life expectancy is 74 years for women and 68 for men · The communist regime allows North Koreans to vote in elections from the age of 17 · Traditionally Buddhist and Confucianist but religious activities are controlled by the government · Gained independence from Japan on August 15 1945, at the end of the second world war, and the DPRK was founded on September 9 1948, a national holiday · Kim Il-sung, known as the Great Leader, ruled for almost five decades until his death on July 8 1994. In September 1998 he was declared Eternal President. His son Kim Jong-il, who took over leadership of the Korean Workers' Party in 1997, had his powers extended to head of state on the same day · In 2002, North Korea was named as part of the 'axis of evil' by George Bush · The Korean People's Army is one of the largest in the world. Troops total more than 1 million, with a further 7 million in reserve units. Around 30% of GDP is spent on the military Compiled by Katy Helsop. Sources: CIA World Factbook; BBC; Global Security
